alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Loudon, western Blount and northeastern Monroe Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, or 15 miles south of Maryville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Louisville, Eagleton Village, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, McGee Carson Peninsula, Happy Valley and Citico Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe
